result.execSummary:
The defendant Trey L. Emerich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 2:20 pm 
INCLUDES 20CM934, 21CF648, 21CF1224, 22CF307, & 22CF656. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Rohloff.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
State moves to: 
In 20CM934: Cts. 2 & 4>>D&RI. 
In 21CF648: Cts. 2, 3, & 5>>D&RI. 
In 21CF1224: Cts. 1 - 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF307: Ct. 3>>D&RI. 
In 22CF656: Cts. 1 - 3, & 6 - 8>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 20CM934: Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 21CF648: Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater/DA/DA Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 22CF307: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater/DA Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 22CF656: Ct. 4 (Criminal Damage to Property/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 5 (Battery/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 9 (Resisting an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 10 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 20CM934: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 3>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
In 21CF648: Ct. 1>>SWH for 4 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 4>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
In 22CF307: Ct. 1>>SWH for 4 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 2>>SWH for 4 yrs probation. 
In 22CF656: Ct. 4>>SWH for 4 yrs probation.  
                   : Ct. 5>>SWH for 4 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 9>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 
                   : Ct. 10>>SWH for 3 yrs probation. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS ON ALL>>attend and successfully complete SAFE program; Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendation; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of drugs/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no contact with BE or SE unless authorized by agent; CC including DNA surcharges (sample already on file) and 6 DA surcharges; 30 hours CS imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITION in 22CF656>>150 days MCJ with EMP if def qualifies- 30 days STAYED for rule violations - def has 30 days to begin imposed conditional jail.

COURT finds def entitled to jail credit as follows: 
In 20CM934>>2 days. 
In 21CF648>>3 days. 
In 22CF307>>4 days. 
In 22CF656>>24 days. 

Probation Review set for 8/19/2022 at 1:15 pm.

No contact with victim(s):  S.M.E.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police (Wausau PD) to retreive any personal property from the residence.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents except for employment purposes.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:21 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Heather Roehr. 
Deft qualifies for SPD representation. 
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $1000 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): SME. 
- Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents except for employment purposes. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
